alert.note: Alert for King George; Spotsylvania; Stafford (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Baltimore/Washington (Washington D.C., Central Maryland, Northern Virginia, Eastern West Virginia)
info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued January 06 at 11:45AM EST until January 07 at 5:00AM EST by NWS Baltimore/Washington
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 9 PM THIS EVENING TO 5 AM EST FRIDAY... * WHAT...Snow. Total snow accumulations of 1 to 3 inches. Isolated higher amounts of around 5 inches are possible. * WHERE...In Maryland, St. Marys County. In Virginia, Spotsylvania, Stafford and King George Counties. * WHEN...From 9 PM this evening to 5 AM EST Friday. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. The hazardous conditions could impact the Friday morning commute. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...The heaviest snow is expected between 1 AM and 5 AM when snowfall rates of 1 inch per hour are possible. Visibility will be reduced to near or less than one- half mile snow.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. When venturing outside, watch your first few steps taken on steps, sidewalks, and driveways, which could be icy and slippery, increasing your risk of a fall and injury.
